content.question: The above circuit is designed with an ideal battery and a capacitor. When the capacitor is fully charged, the charge on the capacitor plates has a magnitude <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is a correct hypothesis for what will happen to the capacitor when a material of dielectric constant <math alttext="kappa" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Îº</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is inserted between the capacitor plates?

choices.label: The charge stored on the capacitor will increase.
The charge stored on the capacitor will decrease.
The potential difference across the plates of the capacitor will increase.
The potential difference across the plates of the capacitor will decrease.
The energy stored on the capacitor will remain the same.

content.answer: The charge stored on the capacitor will increase.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
